intro: Dorstenia cayapia subsp. paraguariensis, commonly known as the Paraguayan mountain fig, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Paraguay and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and related species. The plant is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher altitudes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and plant morphology.
